intro: Rungia parviflora var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and greenhouses.
